item.title: git log
item.description: I always do git log and explore what changes were made by other developers. It is my habit and I don’t expect that other developers do the same. But I would totally be very happy if a git history will become more clean and understandable not only in big open-source projects but also in a majority of company in the software development industry. You need to follow some rules to keep your git history healthy.

item.title: Communication: back in time
item.description: Most of the software companies have migrated to the very convenient and cute messenger, called Slack. To be the decent man I also liked it for a first time. It gave me the feeling of involving in the whole company life. I was a superhero observing different tasks, simultaneously solving different issues. Once I realized that it’s so convenient that I was simply chatting with the college about random stuff. In that evening I had a bell ringing in my head that something wrong with the model that most developers definitely love.
